 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סוּגַר‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==cage, prison== (possibly loan-word from Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***šigaru***</u></abbr>, ***cage*** ([[BDB#Ba|Ba]]<sup>NB 22</sup>); Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סוּגָר‎</span> ***dog-collar*** or ***chain*** = Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (***clog of***) ***dog-collar***; whence Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***dog-collar*** (as loan-word), [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>114</sup> [[BDB#Prä|Prä]]<sup>BAS i. 372</sup>); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּתְּנֻהוּ בַסּוּגַר‎</span> [[Ezek.19.9|Ezek 19:9]] ***and they put him into a cage***.
